name: Four Color Theorem Game
description: The Four Color Theorem Game (or FCTG) is a puzzle game based on a famous mathematical theorem which is really easy to understand, but hard to demonstrate. This theorem states that, given any separation of a plane into contiguous regions, producing a figure called a map, no more than four colors are required to color the regions of the map so that no two adjacent regions have the same color. Also I added some features in game so as to make gameplay more complex (you have to balance colors or some regions are linked). I did this game as an exercice (a large work about List and Array under Unity), trying without succes to find some scripts allowing to create something more or less similar. I guess that it could be interesting for young students. 30 levels. Have fun ++
